paper_abstract: We show that any n-vertex complete graph with edges coloured with three colours contains a set of at most four vertices such that the number of the neighbours of these vertices in one of the colours is at least 2n/3. The previous best value, proved by Erdos, Faudree, Gould, Gyarfas, Rousseau and Schelp in 1989, is 22. It is conjectured that three vertices suffice.
paper_title: A New Bound for the 2/3 Conjecture
